channel.title: terminal on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in terminal on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Command Prompt (cmd.exe)
item.description: cmd.exe is the default command-line interpreter for OS/2, eComStation, Windows, Windows CE, and the ReactOS operating systems.

item.title: Directory commands
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of PowerShell path and directory commands.

item.title: Directory commands
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of environment variables in PowerShell.

item.title: Loops (PowerShell)
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of PowerShell loops.

item.title: PowerShell
item.description: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and associated scripting language.

item.title: PowerShell file utilities
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of PowerShell file utilities.

item.title: PowerShell network utilities
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of PowerShell’s network utilities.

item.title: sh - Shell Command Language
item.description: sh (or the Shell Command Language) is a programming language described by the POSIX standard. It has many implementations (ksh88, dash, …). bash can also be considered an implementation of sh.

item.title: Strings (PowerShell)
item.description: This page provides examples about the use of PowerShell strings and string functions.
